result:
## Summary

**Bug found**: `functools.wraps` fails when decorating classes with AttributeError ✅

I discovered that `functools.wraps` and `functools.update_wrapper` crash when used to wrap classes because class `__dict__` attributes are read-only `mappingproxy` objects that lack the `update()` method. This prevents using these decorators with classes, even though classes are callable objects in Python.

The bug report has been saved to `bug_report_functools_wraps_2025-08-18_04-53_kn9l.md`.
